description: '''Proto-prog''' (short for '''proto-progressive'''{{sfn|Macan|2005|p=xxiii}}) is the earliest work associated with the first wave of [[progressive rock]] music,{{sfn|Holm-Hudson|2013|p=84}}{{sfn|Hegarty|Halliwell|2011|p=11}} known then as "[[progressive pop]]".{{sfn|Moore|2004|p=22}} Such musicians were influenced by [[modern classical]] and other genres usually outside of traditional rock influences. They often employed longer and more complicated compositions, interconnected songs as medley, and [[recording studio as musical instrument|studio composition]].{{sfn|Greene|2016|p=182}} Some of the artists that were essential to the development of progressive rock, rather than just anticipating the movement, include [[the Beatles]], [[the Beach Boys]], [[the Doors]], [[The Mothers of Invention]], [[the Pretty Things]], [[the Zombies]], [[the Byrds]], [[the Grateful Dead]] and [[Pink Floyd]].{{sfn|Hegarty|Halliwell|2011|p=11}}
